result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander A Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 57 days sentence credit.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Condition for Probation.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Continue working towards GED or HSD.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No contact wtih any of the co-defendants (Nicole K. or Chris R.).
No contact with the defendant's girlfriend H. H. d.o.b. 03-03-1998.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is to serve FIRST 30 DAYS Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions, commencing forthwith.
LAST 60 DAYS are STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alexander A Ruiz in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  
Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Mitchell requests bail be addressed and State has no objection. 
Court hears defense bail motion.
Attorney Mitchell presents bail argument to the court.
State objects to bail modification and presents argument.
Court denies motion to modify bail.

Defense proceeds to plea and sentencing.
Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1 with the penalty enhancer dismissed.
Court dismissed penalty enhancer and found defendant guilty of count 1.
Count 2 dismissed and read-in.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT STAYED (CREDIT - 57 days if revoked)
  -  1 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 1/2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling and continue working with GED, HSD.
*No contact with:  codefendants, Nicole Kain or Chris Rhodes, and no contact with defendant's girlfriend, H.H. DOB 3/3/1998 (named in letters previously filed with the court);
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 Apply cash bail, refund balance;

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 Apply cash bail, refund balance;

CONDITION TIME: 90 DAYS, FORTHWITH;  non working hours.  Standard release conditions. Defendant to serve first 30 days forthwith and last 60 days stayed, to be used at agent's discretion. 
DEFENDANT TO BE TRANSFERRED TO THE HUBER FACILITY FORTHWITH.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. 

Expungment requested. 
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
